intro: Lasiopetalum angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved lasiopetalum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open woodlands or heathlands. Lasiopetalum angustifolium is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
